chara.textHome: So? Whaddaya think of my costume?!

It's right in that sweet spot between
cool and cute if ya ask me!
And look, the ears move too!

Nghaaa... Nope, I'm gonna snooze...
Snooze aaall day...

Like the animals,
livin' free in the great outdoors,
with the warm sun and a cool breeze...

Heck yeah!
I'm gonna rehearse the play before lunch!

Food sure tastes better on
an empty stomach!

Gah, Karin's gonna be mad at me if I don't
get to rehearsal ASAP.

I might look like a slacker, but I follow
through when people depend on me!
I am a mercenary after all!
I'm beat. All kinds of dooog tired...

I ain't sensin' any Witches,
so maybe I'll just call it a night...

Wait, there's candy to get!
Trick 'r treatin', here I come!

Hnn? Ah, sorry but I ain't doin' any
mercenary work right now.
Gotta focus on Halloween, y'know...
Wait, for reals? A Witch showed up?!
That changes everythin'!
Got my costume and my bag!

Ya only get one crack at an actin' debut,
so I'm gonna make it awesome!

Me gettin' copied in Mirrors means
there'll be two cows.
Copyin' those two'll make four.
Quick 'n dirty way to get a farm in no time.
Check this bag out!
LOADS of candy'll fit in here!

Yachiyo's too old to get any,
so I'll give her one of mine.
Moo-ha-ha!

Tsuruno and me whipped up
some mashed potatoes!
No, wait, it's this thing called colcannon.
I heard they eat it on Halloween!

The heck's up with this script?!
I can't make heads or tails of
these stage cues!
Who wrote this chicken scratch?!
Oh, wait...I did!

I know my costume rocks,
but check out this sweet bell!
Kanoko made the thing outta brass!

I'm glad Asuka didn't snatch the
cow part away from me.

It ain't every day ya get
to have clothes like this!
I never had lines to say in a play before.

My teachers used to say I muck
everythin' up and forced me be
a stagehand every time.

I had to give out all the candy
we used in the play,
but the kiddos looked pretty happy.
So I guess it's all good.

My dad, he's from Britain or some
English speakin' country.

So we did a lot for Halloween back
when I lived with my family!

When my mom made pumpkin soup,
she'd hollow out the pumpkins into bowls.
It was my job to draw on the faces.
Woohoo! Let's get this fight started!
Yay! I won!
Ha! That's no way to fight!
Yep. Turned out exactly as you'd expect.
Lose? What does that even mean?
